thread.title: 'Dancing With the Stars' kept train hero from Oregon college during shooting
thread.title_full: 'Dancing With the Stars' kept train hero from Oregon college during shooting

author:
Compiled by Tony Hicks

thicks@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: 'Dancing With the Stars' kept train hero from Oregon college during shooting
text:
'Dancing With the Stars' kept train hero from Oregon college during shooting Compiled by Tony Hicks Posted: 10/02/2015 10:33:39 AM PDT Updated: 10/02/2015 10:33:39 AM PDT "Dancing With the Stars" contestant and train hero Alek Skarlatos would have been at Umpqua Community College -- where a gunman Thursday killed at least nine people and wounded at least nine others -- if he wasn't in Southern California for the reality dance show. 
Sources close to Skarlatos told TMZ he already enrolled at the school when the show called, putting a temporary crimp in his plans for an education in law enforcement. He had scheduled classes Tuesdays and Thursdays this semester, so he would've likely been on campus Thursday. 
Skarlatos is an Oregon National Guard member who in August, along with fellow Americans Spencer Stone and Anthony Sadler (and a Brit and two Frenchman), prevented a gunman from opening fire on a train headed to Paris from Amsterdam. 
Skarlatos -- who has many friends in the area -- reportedly left rehearsal Thursday immediately upon hearing about the shooting and flew back to Oregon. Tony Hicks writes celebrity commentary for the Bay Area News Group. Contact him at Facebook.com/BayAreaNewsGroup.TonyHicks or Twitter.com/tonyhicks67 Advertisement
